item.title: Curved kerb at the corner of South End Road and St Crispin Close, 15th November
item.description:
There is a portion of the curved part of the kerb on the corner of South End Road and St Crispin Close that is worn down to the point that it is very slippery, even in dry weather. I helped a gentleman who slipped and fell on that spot on the pavement a few weeks ago. I slipped and injured my knee in the exact same location on Thursday morning; the ground was not wet. I was wearing trainers, and there was zero grip - my leg slipped to the side and there was was nothing I could do to stop myself falling. I had to go to A&E at the Royal Free to make sure nothing was broken, and I am currently unable to walk without aids or travel to work.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): St. Crispin's Close, Belsize Park, Hampstead, London Borough of Camden
Report on FixMyStreet
